newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk Cypriot leader Denktash to visit Turkey.
newsitem.headline: Turk Cypriot leader Denktash to visit Turkey.

text.p: Turkish Cypriot leader Rauf Denktash is to visit Turkey next week amid a row over a planned Greek Cypriot missile deployment, Turkey's foreign ministry said on Wednesday.

It said in a statement that the veteran leader would be in Turkey from January 20-22. Denktash heads a breakaway state in north Cyprus recognised only by Ankara. Turkey maintains 30,000 troops in the northern third of Cyprus which it seized in 1974 in response to a coup in Nicosia engineered by the junta ruling Greece.
Turkish officials have warned that Turkey will use military force to halt the Cypriot government's deployment of the Russian S-300 anti-aircraft missiles, due to go ahead in 16 months' time.
